newsitem.title: TUNISIA: Tunisian auction raises 54.4 million dinars.
newsitem.headline: Tunisian auction raises 54.4 million dinars.

text.p: The Tunisian Treasury raised 54.4 million dinars at its weekly auction of treasury bills dated April 15, and repaid maturing paper totalling 12.6 million dinars.

Rate for two-year notes payable at maturity was down to 6.8750 percent coupon rate from 6.9375 percent last week, but two-year notes payable in equal annual tranches were priced up at 6.8750 percent coupon rate from 6.8125 percent previously.
Herewith breakdown of the auction results:
Banks bid for 261 million dinars for two-year and three-year notes at between 6.8750 and 7.5 percent. (one $=1.09 dinar)
